glosses: to hit, to strike, to pound, to beat
to shoot, to launch a projectile
to beat something to make a sound

examples.translation: he beat the drum to wake him up
the sunlight is falling upon me

glosses: to tie up, to dress up

examples.translation: they tied him up in chains

glosses: to associate with, to connect with
to look like something it is not
to beetle, to tack down, to mall
to make a money in an illegal or immoral way

etymology: Inherited from Ottoman Turkish 塈堭 (urmak, vurmak), from Old Anatolian Turkish 塈堭 (urmaq), from Proto-Turkic *ur-. Cognate with Azerbaijani vurmaq, Old Turkic 偕 (ur-), Kyrgyz  (uruu), Uzbek urmak, Gagauz urmaa, Turkmen urmak.
